p: Antioxidative activity of sesame oil, which likely accounts for a large part of the health benefits of sesame consumption [ 282], has been studied since the 1950â€™s [ 7, 283]. These effects are mainly attributed to the antioxidant activities of sesamin, sesamol, and tocopherols. An excellent recent review focusing on medical implications of antioxidative properties of lignans is available [ 284].
